evidence: the red and green lines - representing the start and end of the main region we care about
triples.o: start and end of the main region

evidence: Zero-padding helps fix the edge effect problem we saw with circular convolution.
Zero-padding means we insert extra zeros at the ends of our signals before performing the convolution.
Adding zero-padding is like putting some extra space between the hands.
The main section we care about remains untouched by unwanted overlaps.
The green section, which previously had interference from wrapping, now stays clean.
This is exactly how we prevent the distortion seen in the Wikipedia example.
This is exactly how we prevent the distortion seen in the Wikipedia example: by padding with enough zeros, the circular convolution result becomes identical to the true linear convolution result.
